text: Oui 0 étoile! La bouffe est de très mauvaise qualité, soupe tonkinoise avec bouillon à l'eau, sauté de légumes avec nouilles croustillantes dont les carottes étaient noires et les nouilles goûtait le mauvais gras. Étant très peu satisfait des plats, nous avons presque rien mangé, les serveurs n'ont même pas demandé si quelque chose clochait. Rendu à la caisse, j'ai voulu communiquer mon insatisfaction, la dame qui ne parle pas français m'a dit que tous les autres clients avaient vidé leur assiette...donc la conversation s'est terminé en lui disant que cela devait être nous le problème...

Love this place since I was a kid! It's honestly a gold mine of delicious and healthy food! The taste is honestly super fresh, and the owners are the one's taking care of you. The menu here is really great value, and it's bring your own wine on top of it all

I've been coming to this Chez Lien since i was a teenager with my mom and bro. You will meet the most humble and sincere staff I've ever met. The restaurant owner greets you, and always remembers my name.. Even after years of not visiting. The food is great, i suggest the "F" plate with a large house salad.. But their crispy noodles are also a favorite of mine. I am there as i write this review from my ipad... I crawled out of bed after feeling sick with a cold all day, and suddenly remembered their citronelle soup used to easily rid of any cold i had when i was younger. I drove over from Laval to Montreal to go to this specific Chez Lien because only they make the citronelle soup. It's an off menu item.. And i can seriously say that whatever they put in their delicious red broth they should carry in a pharmacy! Aside from the delicious food it was nice to see the staff again.. First thing they asked is how my mom and little boy are doing. I sincerely love this place and need to come more often :)
